mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Sullivan, James, 1744-1808
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Mr. Dearbon of Boston carries this letter to Philadephia in hopes of interesting Jefferson in several inventions and gaining patents; among them a perpendicular windmill, a steelyard to prevent fraud, a trigonometrical instrument, and a drawing machine.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1799 January 8, Boston, [Massachusettes], to [Thomas] Jefferson, n.p.
